snippet: The $1.9 billion deal would give Universal Music Group 40 percent of the recorded music market, which regulators say could alter the industry’s landscape.
abstract: European Commission intends to file an antitrust complaint against Universal Music Group's proposed $1.9 billion acquisition of the EMI music recording business, citing concerns that the deal would reduce competition.
lead_paragraph: The $1.9 billion deal would give Universal Music Group 40 percent of the recorded music market, which regulators say could alter the industry’s landscape.

headline.main: Europe Preparing to File Charges in Universal-E.M.I. Deal
headline.print_headline: Europe to Challenge Purchase Of E.M.I. by Universal Music
